newsitem.title: USA: Quaker Oats food operating income drops.
newsitem.headline: Quaker Oats food operating income drops.

text.p: Quaker Oats Co said Thursday its total foods operating income in the third quarter was $89.0 million, down from $90.4 million a year ago.
Total food sales were $840.2 million, three percent above $817.3 million a year ago.

U.S. and Canadian foods operating income of $92.6 million, excluding a $6.4 million restructuring charge, was seven percent above last year's $86.7 million, despite a price decrease for ready-to-eat cereals, Quaker said.
Sales of $687.3 million were two percent above last year's $676.6 million, despite the 15 percent cereal price cut.

Overall unit volume rose one percent from a year ago, as double-digit gains in hot cereals and ready-to-eat cereals, along with single-digit gains in granola bars, Canada and corn goods, offset declines in rice cakes and food service.

"We continue to have positive momentum in hot cereals with six consecutive quarters of volume increases," William Smithburg, chairman, said in a statement. "Our ready-to-eat cereals business also performed very well, with a 14 percent volume gain, in an intensely competitive environment..."
He said the value-priced bagged cereals business continues to grow at double-digit rates.
Operating margins expanded across many U.S. foods businesses, while Quaker held advertising and merchandising basically even in the quarter.
International foods operating income in the quarter was $2.8 milion, down from $3.7 million last year.

Sales of $152.9 million were nine percent above last year's $140.9 million, with increases in Latin America, Europe and the Pacific. Total volume for international foods was three percent below last year, due largely to a decline of sales of food in Brazil.
A Quaker spokesman said the company's pasta business, one of its larger operations in Brazil, had a difficult quarter for competitive reasons.
No separate results for Brazil or the pasta business were available.
